title: Auto-Lambda: Disentangling Dynamic Task Relationships
description: Unlike previous methods where task relationships are assumed to be fixed, Auto-Lambda is a gradient-based meta learning framework which explores continuous, dynamic task relationships via task-specific weightings, and can optimise any choice of combination of tasks through the formulation of a meta-loss; where the validation loss automatically influences task weightings throughout training.

title: PGMax: Factor Graphs for Discrete Probabilistic Graphical Models and Loopy Belief Propagation in JAX
description: PGMax is an open-source Python package for easy specification of discrete Probabilistic Graphical Models (PGMs) as factor graphs, and automatic derivation of efficient and scalable loopy belief propagation (LBP) implementation in JAX.

title: Semi-Supervised Convolutive NMF for Automatic Music Transcription
description: Automatic Music Transcription, which consists in transforming an audio recording of a musical performance into symbolic foßrmat, remains a difficult Music Information Retrieval task.

title: Image-to-Image Regression with Distribution-Free Uncertainty Quantification and Applications in Imaging
description: Image-to-image regression is an important learning task, used frequently in biological imaging.

title: The leap to ordinal: functional prognosis after traumatic brain injury using artificial intelligence
description: We analysed the effect of 2 design elements on ordinal model performance: (1) the baseline predictor set, ranging from a concise set of 10 validated predictors to a token-embedded representation of all possible predictors, and (2) the modelling strategy, from ordinal logistic regression to multinomial deep learning.

title: SUPA: A Lightweight Diagnostic Simulator for Machine Learning in Particle Physics
description: Our contribution is SUPA, the SUrrogate PArticle propagation simulator, an algorithm and software package for generating data by simulating simplified particle propagation, scattering and shower development in matter.

title: Source Code Summarization with Structural Relative Position Guided Transformer
description: We further show that how the proposed SCRIPT captures the structural relative dependencies.

title: A Pragmatic Machine Learning Approach to Quantify Tumor Infiltrating Lymphocytes in Whole Slide Images
description: Our approach is to transfer an open source machine learning method for segmentation and classification of nuclei in H&E slides trained on public data to TIL quantification without manual labeling of our data.

title: One Configuration to Rule Them All? Towards Hyperparameter Transfer in Topic Models using Multi-Objective Bayesian Optimization
description: Topic models are statistical methods that extract underlying topics from document collections.

title: cosFormer: Rethinking Softmax in Attention
description: As one of its core components, the softmax attention helps to capture long-range dependencies yet prohibits its scale-up due to the quadratic space and time complexity to the sequence length.

title: A study of deep perceptual metrics for image quality assessment
description: Several metrics exist to quantify the similarity between images, but they are inefficient when it comes to measure the similarity of highly distorted images.

title: Hamilton-Jacobi equations on graphs with applications to semi-supervised learning and data depth
description: We show that the $p$-eikonal equation with $p=1$ is a provably robust distance-type function on a graph, and the $p\to \infty$ limit recovers shortest path distances.

title: TAFNet: A Three-Stream Adaptive Fusion Network for RGB-T Crowd Counting
description: Specifically, TAFNet is divided into one main stream and two auxiliary streams.

title: Same Cause; Different Effects in the Brain
description: It is then natural to ask: "Is the activity in these different brain zones caused by the stimulus properties in the same way?"

title: Vision-Language Pre-Training with Triple Contrastive Learning
description: Besides CMA, TCL introduces an intra-modal contrastive objective to provide complementary benefits in representation learning.

title: Embarrassingly Simple Performance Prediction for Abductive Natural Language Inference
description: We do this by testing how well the pre-trained models perform on the \alpha{}nli task when just comparing sentence embeddings with cosine similarity to what the performance that is achieved when training a classifier on top of these embeddings.

title: Transferring Adversarial Robustness Through Robust Representation Matching
description: On CIFAR-10, RRM trains a robust model $\sim 1. 8\times$ faster than the state-of-the-art.

title: Variational encoding approach for interpretable assessment of remaining useful life estimation
description: However, most of them lack an explanatory component to understand model learning and/or the nature of the data.

title: BERTVision -- A Parameter-Efficient Approach for Question Answering
description: We present a highly parameter efficient approach for Question Answering that significantly reduces the need for extended BERT fine-tuning.

title: Sky Computing: Accelerating Geo-distributed Computing in Federated Learning
description: In this paper, we proposed Sky Computing, a load-balanced model parallelism framework to adaptively allocate the weights to devices.

title: Precision-medicine-toolbox: An open-source python package for facilitation of quantitative medical imaging and radiomics analysis
description: Medical image analysis plays a key role in precision medicine as it allows the clinicians to identify anatomical abnormalities and it is routinely used in clinical assessment.

title: Differential equation and probability inspired graph neural networks for latent variable learning
description: Inspired by probabilistic theory and differential equations, this paper proposes graph neural networks to solve state estimation and subspace learning problems.

title: Differential equation and probability inspired graph neural networks for latent variable learning
description: Inspired by probabilistic theory and differential equations, this paper proposes graph neural networks to solve state estimation and subspace learning problems.

title: Dialogue Summaries as Dialogue States (DS2), Template-Guided Summarization for Few-shot Dialogue State Tracking
description: In this paper, we hypothesize that dialogue summaries are essentially unstructured dialogue states; hence, we propose to reformulate dialogue state tracking as a dialogue summarization problem.

title: Constrained unsupervised anomaly segmentation
description: In particular, the equality constraint on the attention maps in prior work is replaced by an inequality constraint, which allows more flexibility.

title: An Open Challenge for Inductive Link Prediction on Knowledge Graphs
description: An emerging trend in representation learning over knowledge graphs (KGs) moves beyond transductive link prediction tasks over a fixed set of known entities in favor of inductive tasks that imply training on one graph and performing inference over a new graph with unseen entities.

description: The hard predictions are made when performing semantic segmentation such that each point is associated with a single class.

description: We present that using horizon-depth along with room height can obtain omnidirectional-geometry awareness of room layout in both horizontal and vertical directions.

title: A Simple Hash-Based Early Exiting Approach For Language Understanding and Generation

title: Selective Residual M-Net for Real Image Denoising
description: Image restoration is a low-level vision task which is to restore degraded images to noise-free images.

title: A low-rank ensemble Kalman filter for elliptic observations
description: We propose a regularization method for ensemble Kalman filtering (EnKF) with elliptic observation operators.

title: Multi-modal Graph Learning for Disease Prediction
description: For disease prediction tasks, most existing graph-based methods tend to define the graph manually based on specified modality (e. g., demographic information), and then integrated other modalities to obtain the patient representation by Graph Representation Learning (GRL).

title: Generating natural images with direct Patch Distributions Matching
description: On a number of image generation tasks we show that our results are often superior to single-image-GANs, require no training, and can generate high quality images in a few seconds.

title: Look for the Change: Learning Object States and State-Modifying Actions from Untrimmed Web Videos
description: In this paper, we seek to temporally localize object states (e. g. "empty" and "full" cup) together with the corresponding state-modifying actions ("pouring coffee") in long uncurated videos with minimal supervision.

title: Scale-out Systolic Arrays
description: In this work, we study three key pillars in multi-pod systolic array designs, namely array granularity, interconnect, and tiling.

title: Scale-out Systolic Arrays
description: In this work, we study three key pillars in multi-pod systolic array designs, namely array granularity, interconnect, and tiling.

title: Associating Objects with Scalable Transformers for Video Object Segmentation
description: The state-of-the-art methods learn to decode features with a single positive object and thus have to match and segment each target separately under multi-object scenarios, consuming multiple times computation resources.

title: Modelling continual learning in humans with Hebbian context gating and exponentially decaying task signals
description: Here, we propose novel computational constraints for artificial neural networks, inspired by earlier work on gating in the primate prefrontal cortex, that capture the cost of interleaved training and allow the network to learn two tasks in sequence without forgetting.

title: A Two-phase Framework with a Bézier Simplex-based Interpolation Method for Computationally Expensive Multi-objective Optimization
description: The first phase in TPB aims to approximate a few Pareto optimal solutions by optimizing a sequence of single-objective scalar problems.

title: Selective inference for k-means clustering
description: We consider the problem of testing for a difference in means between clusters of observations identified via k-means clustering.

title: LightHuBERT: Lightweight and Configurable Speech Representation Learning with Once-for-All Hidden-Unit BERT
description: LightHuBERT outperforms the original HuBERT on ASR and five SUPERB tasks with the HuBERT size, achieves comparable performance to the teacher model in most tasks with a reduction of 29% parameters, and obtains a $3. 5\times$ compression ratio in three SUPERB tasks, e. g., automatic speaker verification, keyword spotting, and intent classification, with a slight accuracy loss.

title: Frequency Dynamic Convolution: Frequency-Adaptive Pattern Recognition for Sound Event Detection

title: Analysis of EEG frequency bands for Envisioned Speech Recognition
